{{also|Dann|Dänn}} ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|goh|danne}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*þan}}. Cognate with {{cog|en|then}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/dan/}} * {{audio|de|De-dann.ogg|Audio}} * {{rhymes|de|an}} ===Adverb=== {{de-adv}} # [[then]], [[after]] [[that]] #: {{ux|de|Ich ziehe mich erst an, '''dann''' frühstücke ich.|First I'm getting dressed, then I'll have breakfast.}} # [[then]], [[in]] [[that]] [[case]] #: {{ux|de|Wenn du dich anstrengst, '''dann''' schaffst du es.|If you make an effort, then you'll be able to do it.}} ====Usage notes==== The functional split between ''dann'' and {{m|de|denn}} was prescribed only by the grammarians of the 18th century. In colloquial German, the two words may still overlap. One will occasionally hear ''denn'' instead of ''dann'' in northern Germany, and vice versa in western and southern Germany. ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} ---- ==Hunsrik== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|hrx|goh|danne}}, from {{inh|hrx|gem-pro|*þan}}. Cognate with {{cog|de|dann}} and {{cog|en|then}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|hrx|/tan/}} * {{homophones|hrx|Dann}} ===Adverb=== {{head|hrx|adverb}} # [[then]], [[after]] [[that]] #: {{ux|hrx|Ich hon drei mol gerufd, '''dann''' hon-ich geschreud.|I called three times, '''then''' I screamed.}} ====Synonyms==== *{{l|hrx|do}} ===Further reading=== * [https://hunsriqueanoriograndense.wordpress.com/dicionario-werterbuch/ Online Hunsrik Dictionary] ---- ==Luxembourgish== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|lb|goh|danne}}, from {{inh|lb|gem-pro|*þan}}. Cognate with {{cog|de|dann}} and {{cog|en|then}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|lb|/da(n)/|[dɑn]}} *: {{rhymes|lb|ɑn}} ===Adverb=== {{head|lb|adverb}} # [[then]] (at that time) # [[then]] (after that; next) # [[then]] (in that case) ====Usage notes==== * The word refers to the present and future. For the past use {{m|lb|dunn}}. ---- ==Norwegian Bokmål== ===Verb=== {{head|nb|verb form}} # {{inflection of|nb|danne||imp}}
